head.title: POSTINGS: Municipal Art Society Walks; Tours Discover Old New York

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: Municipal Art Society Walks; Tours Discover Old New York

abstract.p: Municipal Art Society offers architectural history tours of New York City (S)

block.p: Architectural historians will be marching into the city's past this week in five afternoon ''Discover New York'' tours sponsored by the Municipal Art Society.

The statues of Madison Square Park, which include such local heroes as Admiral David Glasgow Farragut and William H. Seward, will be included in a tour of the Flatiron District led by Francis Morrone tomorrow at 12:30 P.M. The tour begins on the northwest corner of Park Avenue South and 23d Street. On Tuesday at 12:30, a walk through the past of Greenwich Village, offered by John Wilson, begins at the Washington Square Arch at the foot of Fifth Avenue.
Architectural historians will be marching into the city's past this week in five afternoon ''Discover New York'' tours sponsored by the Municipal Art Society.

The statues of Madison Square Park, which include such local heroes as Admiral David Glasgow Farragut and William H. Seward, will be included in a tour of the Flatiron District led by Francis Morrone tomorrow at 12:30 P.M. The tour begins on the northwest corner of Park Avenue South and 23d Street. On Tuesday at 12:30, a walk through the past of Greenwich Village, offered by John Wilson, begins at the Washington Square Arch at the foot of Fifth Avenue.

On Thursday, the more modern-minded can take a closer look at 53d Street, between the Avenue of the Americas and Lexington Avenue, with the help of John Kriskiewicz, who will focus on buildings by modern architects such as Philip Johnson. The tour will begin at 12:30 in the lobby of the CBS building, on the southeast corner of 53d Street and the Avenue of the Americas.

Cast-iron architecture is the subject on Friday of a walk through SoHo led by Matthew Postal, starting at 12:30 at the Canal Street Post Office on the southwest corner of Church Street. On Saturday at 1, Mr. Postal will look at the cinematic past and future of Times Square. That tour begins at the Ed Sullivan Theater, Broadway at 53d Street. The weekday tours cost $10; the Saturday tour is $15. Information: (212) 935-3960.
